title: Dr Melanie O'Brien
subtitle: Dwellings in the #Rohingya #refugees camps further south (newer camps) are not as sturdy as those in the camps further north (older camps). There are less services generally, likely because those camps are further from #CXB & haven't been there as long as the northern ones.pic.twitter.com/jJFnNE3sgH

title: Public Health Association Australia
subtitle:
Today we have teamed up with @Drs4Refugees to urge the federal senate not repeal the Medevac legislation.
The law is working to save lives. It does not impact on refugee determinations or any immigration decisions. @JacquiLambie @AmosCam
https://www.phaa.net.au/documents/item/4107 …pic.twitter.com/Qz1yxFJQL8

title: Ghaith S. Zakaria

title: Stephanie McLennan
subtitle: Concerning trend in #Australia where citizenship and permanent residency is becoming harder to obtain and easier to lose. The main people who lose out are refugees and those seeking asylum who are stuck in a state of limbo and insecurity. At @KaldorCentre’s #Kaldor19 conference.pic.twitter.com/4fVn8182WT

title: Kaldor Centre UNSW

title: Kaldor Centre UNSW
subtitle: Our second panellist, @jetten_j, is now introducing her research on the attitudes of the general public towards #refugees and migrants more generally, and the factors that determine the content of those attitudes. #Kaldor19pic.twitter.com/TcNReoKXAk

title: Sarah English
